metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: CSS Image Filter Effects
The CSS filter property is used to add visual effects to elements.
content.html: The CSS filter property is used to add visual effects to elements.

content.text: CSS Filters
The CSS filter property is used to add visual effects (like blur and saturation) to elements.
content.html: The CSS filter property is used to add visual effects (like blur and saturation) to elements.

content.text: Within the filter property, you can use the following CSS functions:
content.html: Within the filter property, you can use the following CSS functions:

content.text: The CSS blur() Function
The blur() filter function applies a blur effect to an element. A larger value will create more blur.
content.html: The blur() filter function applies a blur effect to an element. A larger value will create more blur.

content.code_html:
#img1 {
  filter: blur(2px);
}

#img2 {
  filter: blur(6px);
}

content.text: The CSS brightness() Function
The brightness() filter function adjusts the brightness of an element.
content.html: The brightness() filter function adjusts the brightness of an element.

content.code_html:
#img1 {
  filter: brightness(150%);
}

#img2 {
  filter: brightness(50%);
}

content.text: The CSS contrast() Function
The contrast() filter function adjusts the contrast of an element.
content.html: The contrast() filter function adjusts the contrast of an element.

content.code_html:
#img1 {
  filter: contrast(150%);
}

#img2 {
  filter: contrast(50%);
}

content.text: The CSS drop-shadow() Function
The drop-shadow() filter function applies a drop-shadow effect to an image.
content.html: The drop-shadow() filter function applies a drop-shadow effect to an image.

syntaxHighlighting.text:
#img1 {  filter: drop-shadow(8px 8px 10px gray);}#img2 {  
  filter: drop-shadow(10px 10px 7px lightblue);}

content.code:
#img1 {  filter: drop-shadow(8px 8px 10px gray);}#img2 {
filter: drop-shadow(10px 10px 7px lightblue);}

syntax_highlighting.text:
#img1 {  filter: drop-shadow(8px 8px 10px gray);}#img2 {  
  filter: drop-shadow(10px 10px 7px lightblue);}

content.code_html:
#img1 {
  filter: drop-shadow(8px 8px 10px gray);
}

#img2 {
  filter: drop-shadow(10px 10px 7px lightblue);
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
#img1 {  filter: drop-shadow(8px 8px 10px gray);}#img2 {  
  filter: drop-shadow(10px 10px 7px lightblue);}

content.text: The CSS grayscale() Function
The grayscale() filter function converts an image to grayscale.
content.html: The grayscale() filter function converts an image to grayscale.

syntaxHighlighting.text:
#img1 {  filter: grayscale(1);}#img2 {  filter: 
  grayscale(60%);}#img3 {  filter: grayscale(0.4);}

content.code:
#img1 {  filter: grayscale(1);}#img2 {  filter:
grayscale(60%);}#img3 {  filter: grayscale(0.4);}

syntax_highlighting.text:
#img1 {  filter: grayscale(1);}#img2 {  filter: 
  grayscale(60%);}#img3 {  filter: grayscale(0.4);}

content.code_html:
#img1 {
  filter: grayscale(1);
}

#img2 {
  filter: grayscale(60%);
}

#img3 {
  filter: grayscale(0.4);
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
#img1 {  filter: grayscale(1);}#img2 {  filter: 
  grayscale(60%);}#img3 {  filter: grayscale(0.4);}

content.text: The CSS hue-rotate() Function
The hue-rotate() filter function applies a color rotation to an element.
content.html: The hue-rotate() filter function applies a color rotation to an element.

content.text: This function applies a hue rotation on the image. The value defines the number of degrees around the color circle the image will be adjusted. A positive hue rotation increases the hue value, while a negative rotation decreases the hue value. 0deg represents the original image.
content.html: This function applies a hue rotation on the image. The value defines the number of degrees around the color circle the image will be adjusted. A positive hue rotation increases the hue value, while a negative rotation decreases the hue value. 0deg represents the original image.

content.code_html:
#img1 {
  filter: hue-rotate(200deg);
}

#img2 {
  filter: hue-rotate(90deg);
}

#img3 {
  filter: hue-rotate(-90deg);
}

content.text: The CSS invert() Function
The invert() filter function inverts the color of an image.
content.html: The invert() filter function inverts the color of an image.

syntaxHighlighting.text:
#img1 {  filter: invert(0.3);}#img2 {  filter: 
  invert(70%);}#img3 {  filter: invert(100%);}

content.code:
#img1 {  filter: invert(0.3);}#img2 {  filter:
invert(70%);}#img3 {  filter: invert(100%);}

syntax_highlighting.text:
#img1 {  filter: invert(0.3);}#img2 {  filter: 
  invert(70%);}#img3 {  filter: invert(100%);}

content.code_html:
#img1 {
  filter: invert(0.3);
}

#img2 {
  filter: invert(70%);
}

#img3 {
  filter: invert(100%);
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
#img1 {  filter: invert(0.3);}#img2 {  filter: 
  invert(70%);}#img3 {  filter: invert(100%);}

content.text: The CSS opacity() Function
The opacity() filter function applies an opacity effect to an element.
content.html: The opacity() filter function applies an opacity effect to an element.

syntaxHighlighting.text:
#img1 {  filter: opacity(80%);}#img2 {  filter: 
  opacity(50%);}#img3 {  filter: opacity(0.2);}

content.code:
#img1 {  filter: opacity(80%);}#img2 {  filter:
opacity(50%);}#img3 {  filter: opacity(0.2);}

syntax_highlighting.text:

  opacity(50%);}#img3 {  filter: opacity(0.2);}

content.code_html:

  filter: opacity(80%);
}

#img2 {
  filter: opacity(50%);
}

#img3 {

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
#img1 {  filter: opacity(80%);}#img2 {  filter: 
  opacity(50%);}#img3 {  filter: opacity(0.2);}

content.text: The CSS saturate() Function
The saturate() filter function adjusts the saturation (color intensity) of an element.
content.html: The saturate() filter function adjusts the saturation (color intensity) of an element.

syntaxHighlighting.text:
#img1 {  filter: saturate(0);}#img2 {  filter: 
  saturate(100%);}#img3 {  filter: saturate(200%);}

content.code:
#img1 {  filter: saturate(0);}#img2 {  filter:
saturate(100%);}#img3 {  filter: saturate(200%);}

syntax_highlighting.text:
#img1 {  filter: saturate(0);}#img2 {  filter: 
  saturate(100%);}#img3 {  filter: saturate(200%);}

content.code_html:
#img1 {
  filter: saturate(0);
}

#img2 {
  filter: saturate(100%);
}

#img3 {
  filter: saturate(200%);
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
#img1 {  filter: saturate(0);}#img2 {  filter: 
  saturate(100%);}#img3 {  filter: saturate(200%);}

content.text: The CSS sepia() Function
The sepia() filter function converts an image to sepia (a warmer, more brown/yellow color).
content.html: The sepia() filter function converts an image to sepia (a warmer, more brown/yellow color).

content.code_html:
#img1 {
  filter: sepia(1);
}

#img2 {
  filter: sepia(60%);
}

#img3 {
  filter: sepia(0.4);
}

content.text: CSS Filter Functions
The following table lists the CSS filter functions:
content.html: The following table lists the CSS filter functions:

content.code_html:
Function Description
blur() Applies a blur effect to an element
brightness() Adjusts the brightness of an element
contrast() Adjusts the contrast of an element
drop-shadow() Applies a drop-shadow effect to an image
grayscale() Converts an image to grayscale
hue-rotate() Applies a color rotation to an element
invert() Inverts the color of an image
opacity() Applies an opacity effect to an element
saturate() Adjusts the saturation (color intensity) of an element
sepia() Converts an image to sepia
